title: Victorian Health Department in Court Over Quarantine
description: Hotel quarantine workers in PPE are seen at the Intercontinental Hotel in Melbourne, Australia, on April 8, 2021. (Asanka Ratnayake/Getty Images)

title: White House Responds After Protests Erupt Across China Over ‘Zero-COVID’ Rules
description: White House COVID-19 Response Coordinator Dr. Ashish Jha speaks to reporters during a press briefing at the White House in Washington on July 25, 2022. (Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images)

title: MP Candice Bergen Disputes Media Interpretation of Call With PM Amid Convoy Protest
description: Families join the Freedom Convoy protest in downtown Ottawa after police distributed arrest notices to truckers and their supporters occupying Wellington St. and the Parliament Hill area on Feb. 16, 2022. (Richard Moore/The Epoch Times)

title: US Soccer Briefly Removed Emblem From Iran Flag to Show Support for Protesters
description: A U.S. soccer federation screenshot displaying Iran's national flag on social media without the emblem of the Islamic Republic. (Instagram via AP)

title: UK Police ‘Fully Prepared’ to Counter Road-Blocking Protests by Climate Activists
description: Police officers remove a campaigner from a Just Stop Oil protest on The Mall, near Buckingham Palace, London, on Oct. 10, 2022. (Jonathan Brady/PA Media)

title: Joly Unveils Canada’s Indo-Pacific Strategy, Investing $2.2. Billion Over the Next Five Years
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Melanie Joly rises during question period in Ottawa on Nov. 24, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Adrian Wyld)

title: Croatia Downs Canada 4–1 at World Cup on Kramaric’s 2 Goals
description: Croatia's Andrej Kramaric celebrates after scoring his side's opening goal during the World Cup group F soccer match between Croatia and Canada, at the Khalifa International Stadium in Doha, Qatar, on Nov. 27, 2022. (Aijaz Rahi/AP Photo)

title: UK to Vaccinate Newly Arrived Illegal Immigrants Against Diphtheria After One Death Reported
description: Accommodation buildings, seen through a barrier, at the illegal immigrant processing centre in Manston, Kent, England, on Nov. 9, 2022. (Chris Summers/The Epoch Times)

title: Students’ Demonstration During Graduation Ceremony of CUHK Interfered With by Security Guards and Police
description: The Chinese University of Hong Kong held a graduation ceremony on Nov. 24. During the ceremony, students made a protest and had an altercation with the security guards present who later called the police. (Facebook picture of University Community Press)

title: Halt Vaccination of Young People Until Vaccine-Linked Myocarditis Is Studied: MIT Professor
description: Retsef Levi, an expert in risk management and health systems and a professor at the MIT Sloan School of Management, in New York, on Oct. 26, 2022. (The Epoch Times)

title: Australian Supermarkets Form Taskforce to Combat Collapse of Recycling Program

title: UN Experts Call for Investigating Taliban’s Treatment of Women After Public Lashings
description: Taliban fighters celebrate one year since they seized the Afghan capital, Kabul, in front of the U.S. Embassy in Kabul, Afghanistan, on Aug. 15, 2022. (Ebrahim Noroozi/AP Photo)

title: ACT Senator Strikes Deal Giving Australia’s Labor Government Crucial Vote for Passing Industrial Relations Bill
description: Childcare workers and supporters from Dawson Street Child Care Co-operative walk down Sydney Road during a protest march as part of a campaign in Melbourne, Australia, for higher wages on March 8, 2017. (Scott Barbour/Getty Images)

title: Instead of ‘Overreaction’ in Using Emergencies Act on Convoy, Trudeau Should Be Concerned With Foreign Interference: O’Toole

title: Rugby Star and ALS Campaigner Doddie Weir Dies at 52
description: Scottish Rugby player Doddie Weir visits the Scottish Parliament, to be present for Rachael Hamilton MSP’s debate in the Scottish Parliament on their joint campaign for automatic access to the Blue Badge Scheme for people with MND, on Sept.26, 2019. (Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images)

title: Pakistan’s Central Bank Hikes Interest Rate to Highest Level Since 1999
